title: Riot showing their true colours

embed.description: Riot Games says they will perma ban Highest Mastery Points Singed, AdellaideSkyhart if he continues to play Support Smite Singed due to it negatively effected his team mates. He has been reported a number of times because of his non-meta playstyle. Do you think he deserves to be perma banned or even constantly suspended?

body: I think everything is summed up and explained pretty clearly here. Even if the ban had nothing to do with his playstyle and it was the fact that he was leaving his adc to 1v2 Riot you forget that its still all within the "meta". Is a support really suppose to be supporting the adc or the team as a whole? From what I see he's clearly giving his jgler and toplane a lead and putting the enemy behind which probably explains why he actually has a positive winrate and actually MANAGED TO CLIMB TO PLAT. He provides evidence that he communicates to his team before every game what he's going to do and as farfetched as a lot of random ass strategies, his has been proven to work. You forget that your company itself has the rule "Don't ban summoners for not enforcing the meta" you silly cucks now you know how much you've screwed up. I hope you feel ashamed of what you've done because this is ridiculous and I actually feel sorry for this poor guy. He was positive to his teammates, he communicated effectively, he was nice, so why do you have to suspend someone for playing the damn game? Keep increasing your bad reputation Riot only makes everything better.

First of all, it is actually against Riots rules to report someone for not sticking to meta. If riot followed their own rules, the people who would be receiving punishments would be the people who reported this singed.

Secondly, this singed actually has evidence that he always communicates with his team and only plays singed support if his team agrees to it.

He isn't breaking any rules, he's actually being extremely nice about it and communicating with his team, and he managed to climb to platinum with this so called 'off-meta' pick. He is in no wrong, and Riot definitely should not be banning him.

His singed support is ~40% win rate
His form of communication is copy pasting his intent every champ select and still going regardless of what the team says

Check out the official Riot response stickied on the main boards.

But IMO its about being a bit flexible for both parties (the meta breakers and meta pickers). Meta pickers need to be a bit more understanding and play around meta breakers a bit more. BUT meta breakers need to also at least sometimes be flexible and be a team player. 

IMO in this case he was just declaring what he was doing and picking it regardless of what was said after his copy paste (although in Riots response thread it sounds like hes getting better!).

Actually, it seems Riot has a pretty clear idea of what "trolling" actually is since it is determined *by the community* via reports, which this "support" singed received hundreds of for his largely off-META pick and strategy. The issue is that he continued to use that strategy in situations where even the vast majority of his team (4 players) were directly opposed to it, which is *exactly* what defines a "troll".

>
> How can he troll if he has above average win rate

By that logic, how can Boosting be wrong? They have an above average win rate, so why is that against the rules?

Simply put, it ruins the experience, which is exactly the issue with players like this "support" singed. They don't care about actually being part of a team, all they care about is what *they* can do and the enjoyment *they* get from the game, never mind the 4-9 other players in any given match. They simply don't care about anyone but themselves and they justify it with "above average win-rates".

You get someone announcing "mid or feed" in champ select, you put it down to them being a troll. How is this really that different? This player was simply announcing their intentions to perform a particular strategy and that they were going to continue with it regardless of how the *team* felt about it. If that's not trolling, then you have no right to complain about *any* "strategy" they players might employ to get their way, which includes the "mid or feed" bullsh!t that certain trolls might do.
